availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Zeno B. Freeman (QM Sergeant 3rd Ky. Cav, and Adj. and 1st Lieut. 12th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, grocer and soldier. New York native. Married to Elenora "Ellen" Freeman. Father of Maude Freeman. Grocer in McLean County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as quarter-master sergeant from December 13, 1861, to February 11, 1863. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as adjutant and first lieutenant from April 17, 1863, to December 23, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoun, p. 6.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoun, p. 201A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 70.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 302-3.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0022.
Find A Grave, "Zeno B. Freeman (25 Feb 1819- 19 Jan 1875)," Memorial #88526639, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/88526639 (accessed October 1, 2020).
